cyclone.name: LIDIA
cyclone.current_location: about 260 miles SSE of the southern tip of Baja California
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest toward Baja California Sur, then forecast to skirt the Pacific side of the peninsula and weaken while turning northwest over open water
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southern tip of Baja California Sur (Cabo San Lucas/La Paz area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Puerto Cortes to east of La Paz, Baja California Sur; Tropical Storm Watch west of La Paz to Loreto and mainland Mexico from Bahia Tempehuaya to Huatabampito
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Santa Fe to La Paz, Baja California Sur
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Pacific coast of western Mexico and southern/central Baja California Sur
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional gusts possible late Sunday into Monday, but sustained tropical-storm force winds are unlikely (<10% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the San Diego waterfront.
weather_observation.rainfall: Moisture from Lidia may bring scattered showers and brief heavy downpours early next week, but widespread totals should stay under 1 inch.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period south-southwest swells could produce elevated surf and rip-current risk along San Diego beaches this weekend and early next week.
